name: The Creative
judgment: The Creative works sublime success, furthering through perseverance.
image: The movement of heaven is full of power. Thus the superior man makes himself strong and untiring.
description: Pure creative energy. Initiative, leadership, and primal force manifest in the material world.

changing_lines.2: Dragon appearing in the field. It furthers one to see the great man.
changing_lines.3: All day long the superior man is creatively active. At nightfall his mind is still beset with cares. Danger. No blame.
changing_lines.4: Wavering flight over the depths. No blame.
changing_lines.5: Flying dragon in the heavens. It furthers one to see the great man.
changing_lines.6: Arrogant dragon will have cause to repent.

name: The Receptive
judgment: The Receptive brings about sublime success, furthering through the perseverance of a mare.
image: The earth's condition is receptive devotion. Thus the superior man who has breadth of character carries the outer world.
description: Pure receptive energy. Yielding, nurturing, and supportive force that complements the creative.

changing_lines.1: When there is hoarfrost underfoot, solid ice is not far off.
changing_lines.2: Straight, square, great. Without purpose, yet nothing remains unfurthered.
changing_lines.3: Hidden lines. One is able to remain persevering. If by chance you are in the service of a king, seek not works, but bring to completion.
changing_lines.4: A tied-up sack. No blame, no praise.
changing_lines.5: A yellow lower garment brings supreme good fortune.
changing_lines.6: Dragons fight in the meadow. Their blood is black and yellow.

name: Difficulty at the Beginning
judgment: Difficulty at the Beginning works sublime success, furthering through perseverance.
image: Clouds and thunder: The image of Difficulty at the Beginning. Thus the superior man brings order out of confusion.
description: Initial chaos before creation. Like a plant breaking through earth, growth requires patience and persistence.

changing_lines.1: Hesitation and hindrance. It furthers one to remain persevering. It furthers one to appoint helpers.
changing_lines.2: Difficulties pile up. Horse and wagon part company. He is not a robber; he wants to woo when the time comes.
changing_lines.3: Whoever hunts deer without the forester only loses his way in the forest. The superior man understands the signs of the time and prefers to desist.
changing_lines.4: Horse and wagon part company. Strive for union. To go brings good fortune. Everything acts to further.
changing_lines.5: Difficulties in blessing. A little perseverance brings good fortune. Great perseverance brings misfortune.
changing_lines.6: Horse and wagon part company. Bloody tears flow.

name: Youthful Folly
judgment: Youthful Folly has success. It is not I who seek the young fool; the young fool seeks me.
image: A spring wells up at the foot of the mountain: The image of Youth. Thus the superior man fosters his character by thoroughness in all that he does.
description: The innocence of youth seeking wisdom. Learning requires humility and the right teacher-student relationship.

changing_lines.1: To make a fool develop it furthers one to apply discipline. The fetters should be removed. To go on in this way brings humiliation.
changing_lines.2: To bear with fools in kindliness brings good fortune. To know how to take women brings good fortune. The son is capable of taking charge of the household.
changing_lines.3: Take not a maiden who, when she sees a man of bronze, loses possession of herself. Nothing furthers.
changing_lines.6: In punishing folly it does not further one to commit transgressions. The only thing that furthers is to prevent transgressions.

name: Waiting
judgment: Waiting. If you are sincere, you have light and success. Perseverance brings good fortune.
image: Clouds rise up to heaven: The image of Waiting. Thus the superior man eats and drinks, is joyous and of good cheer.
description: Patient anticipation before action. Like clouds gathering before rain, timing is everything.

changing_lines.1: Waiting in the meadow. It furthers one to abide in what endures. No blame.
changing_lines.2: Waiting on the sand. There is some gossip. The end brings good fortune.
changing_lines.3: Waiting in the mud brings about the arrival of the enemy.
changing_lines.4: Waiting in blood. Get out of the pit.
changing_lines.5: Waiting at meat and drink. Perseverance brings good fortune.
changing_lines.6: One falls into the pit. Three uninvited guests arrive. Honor them, and in the end there will be good fortune.

name: Conflict
judgment: Conflict. You are sincere and are being obstructed. A cautious halt halfway brings good fortune.
image: Heaven and water go their opposite ways: The image of Conflict. Thus in all his transactions the superior man carefully considers the beginning.
description: Opposition and tension requiring careful navigation. Not all conflicts can or should be won.

changing_lines.1: If one does not perpetuate the affair, there is a little gossip. In the end, good fortune comes.
changing_lines.2: One cannot engage in conflict; one returns home, gives way. The people of his town, three hundred households, remain free of guilt.
changing_lines.3: To nourish oneself on ancient virtue induces perseverance. Danger. In the end, good fortune comes.
changing_lines.4: One cannot engage in conflict. One turns back and submits to fate, changes one's attitude, and finds peace in perseverance.
changing_lines.5: To contend before him brings supreme good fortune.
changing_lines.6: Even if by chance a leather belt is bestowed on one, by the end of a morning it will have been snatched away three times.
